	Submit daily and weekly performance and stock reports to the Head of Warehouse.


Salary
N90,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;midaasconsult@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Warehouse Supervisor Job at J3 Holdings




        
    

        
        J3 is an FMCG distributor. We have been in existence for over 8 years and we have branches in the followinf locations:  Lagos, Ibadan, Ogun, Ondo, and Osun state.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location: Berger, Lagos

Job Description


	The Warehouse Supervisor oversees inventory management, timely loading/unloading of goods, stock accuracy, coordination with sales and logistics teams, and ensures order, cleanliness, and safety within the warehouse.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate stock records using manual or digital tools.
	Conduct daily stock counts and reconcile physical vs. system records.
	Enforce FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First Expiry, First-Out) principles.
	Report low stock levels and coordinate restocking.
	Identify and report slow-moving stock to prevent expiry.
	Ensure all inventory activities follow the company’s SOPs and stock handling guidelines.
	Conduct regular stock checks and cycle counts to detect discrepancies.
	Assist in stock audits and ensure supporting documents are filed and available for review.
	Oversee proper storage practices: product labeling, stacking, and safe handling (especially for perishables).
	Coordinate preparation and ensure the accuracy of all stock-related documents (e.g., GRNs, waybills, delivery notes).
	Report stock variances, damages, or shortages to the Head of Warehouse Operations, with root cause analysis and suggested resolutions.
	Submit daily and weekly performance and stock reports to the Head of Warehouse.


Salary
N90,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: midaasconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information, contact on WhatsApp 09152781100.

Job Position: Customer Experience Cashier / Sales Support Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Berger, Lagos

Description


	The Customer Experience Cashier is responsible for processing transactions efficiently while delivering excellent customer service, promoting repeat sales, and supporting the sales and operations teams.
	The role goes beyond traditional cashiering to include customer relationship building, upselling, after-sales engagement, and contributing to overall outlet performance.


Key Responsibilities
Cashiering and Transaction Management:


	Promptly generate accurate sales invoices based on order details.
	Handle cash, POS, and bank transfer payments.
	Verify payment evidence (transfers, receipts, teller slips) for correctness (amount, reference, account details).
	Forward all payment documentation to the Accounts Officer/Accountant for confirmation.
	Follow up to ensure timely payment confirmations.
	Notify the relevant department (e.g., warehouse) once payments are approved for release.
	Maintain accurate records of all invoices and receipts.
	Ensure all transaction activities align with internal financial policies.
	Submit daily/weekly transaction reports to the Accounts department.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / OND qualification with relevant experience.


Salary
N80,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;midaasconsult@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Customer Experience Cashier / Sales Support Executive Job at Holdings




        
    

        
        J3 is an FMCG distributor. We have been in existence for over 8 years and we have branches in the followinf locations:  Lagos, Ibadan, Ogun, Ondo, and Osun state.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Experience Cashier / Sales Support Executive

Job Location: Berger, Lagos

Description
     

            
    




	The Customer Experience Cashier is responsible for processing transactions efficiently while delivering excellent customer service, promoting repeat sales, and supporting the sales and operations teams.
	The role goes beyond traditional cashiering to include customer relationship building, upselling, after-sales engagement, and contributing to overall outlet performance.


Key Responsibilities
Cashiering and Transaction Management:


	Promptly generate accurate sales invoices based on order details.
	Handle cash, POS, and bank transfer payments.
	Verify payment evidence (transfers, receipts, teller slips) for correctness (amount, reference, account details).
	Forward all payment documentation to the Accounts Officer/Accountant for confirmation.
	Follow up to ensure timely payment confirmations.
	Notify the relevant department (e.g., warehouse) once payments are approved for release.
	Maintain accurate records of all invoices and receipts.
	Ensure all transaction activities align with internal financial policies.
	Submit daily/weekly transaction reports to the Accounts department.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / OND qualification with relevant experience.


Salary
N80,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: midaasconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information, contact onWhatsApp 09152781100.

Project Manager Job at Myrtle Management Consultants




        
    

        
        Myrtle Management Consultants - Our client is a marine logistics service provider in the Nigerian Oil and Gas Industry. They also offer services beyond the marine segment of the industry to the Subsea and Engineering sectors.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Our client is seeking a highly motivated Project Manager to join their team.
	This role involves assisting in chartering operations, managing project cargo movements, coordinating logistics, and ensuring smooth execution of shipping contracts.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the maritime industry, excellent negotiation skills, and the ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities
Chartering & Operations:


	Assist in fixing and negotiating charter parties for vessels .
	Conduct freight rate analysis and market research to identify opportunities.
	Liaise with ship owners, brokers, and clients to ensure smooth chartering operations.
	Monitor vessel performance, bunker consumption, and ensure compliance with charter party terms.
	Assist in contract management, ensuring compliance with industry regulations.


Project Management & Logistics:


	Oversee the planning and execution of shipping projects, ensuring timely and cost-effective delivery.
	Manage documentation, including bills of lading, cargo manifests, and customs paperwork.
	Track shipments and provide clients with regular updates on cargo movements.
	Work closely with internal teams to ensure smooth project execution and problem resolution.


Risk Management & Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with international maritime laws, safety regulations, and company policies.
	Assist in handling disputes and claims related to cargo or chartering contracts.


Client & Stakeholder Engagement:


	Maintain strong relationships with ship owners, brokers, customers, and other industry stakeholders.
	Assist in developing new business opportunities by identifying potential chartering prospects.
	Support commercial teams in preparing proposals and presentations for clients.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Maritime Studies, Shipping & Logistics, Business, or a related field.
	1-3 years of experience in chartering, shipping operations, or project management.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and maritime software
	Willingness to travel and work flexible hours as needed.


Remuneration
Competitive along with other benefits.

Note


	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Further assessments will be required.
